basics.name: Bach Hoang
basics.label: Undergraduate Researcher
basics.summary: Mathematics and Computer Science undergraduate at University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign with research interests in formal verification, safe autonomy, quantum computing, and cybersecurity. GPA: 3.92/4.0, Dean's List.

work.name: Coordinated Science Lab (CSL)
work.position: Research Intern, Reliable Autonomy Research Group
work.summary: Working under Prof. Sayan Mitra's guidance on analyzing and testing Verse, a Python Library for Reasoning About Multi-agent Hybrid System Scenarios.
highlights: Providing documentation for Verse code for future development and educational purposes
Investigating how to integrate the newly starset implementation to Verse

work.name: Coordinated Science Lab (CSL)
work.position: Research Assistant, Reliable Autonomy Research Group
work.summary: Working directly under the guidance of Prof. Sayan Mitra on formalizing hybrid automata on Lean theorem prover.
highlights: Using Lean to prove several characteristics of hybrid automata models including inductive invariants
Using Lean to prove and verify algorithms for safe autonomy including reachability analysis and control synthesis

work.name: National Center for Supercomputing Applications
work.position: Research Intern, Student Pushing Innovation Intern
work.summary: Work directly under the guidance Dr. Santiago Nunez-Corrales on a project: quAPL-V, a high-level programming language for quantum computing.
highlights: Formalizing verification steps that can be offloaded to Z3 and generate output of various quantum programs
Work accepted as an Extended Abstract at PLDI ARRAY'24

work.name: National Center for Supercomputing Applications
work.summary: Working directly with Dr. Phuong Cao and 3 students to measure post-quantum cryptography network protocol adoption.
highlights: Collecting data from seven network layers and implementing data analysis on 13TB of network logs generated by Zeek
Co-author on a paper accepted to 2024 IEEE International Conference on Quantum Computing and Engineering (QCE'24)

work.name: National Center for Supercomputing Applications
work.position: Research Fellow, SciAuth Students Fellow Program
work.summary: Working directly with Dr. Jim Basney to work on verifying and assessing security for SciTokens, a federated ecosystem for authorization on distributed computing.
highlights: Synthesized > 18,000 lines of code of verified and functional code
